titleStmt.title: Description of Special Collections, Lehigh Codex 5: John Cassian. Coliatiosses XXIV
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: Stub between fols. 11 and 23 is attached to front pastedown (now Flyleaf 1)
Stub between fols. 147 and 148 is attached to back pastedown (now Flyleaf 1)

msContents.summary: This book is a fourteenth-century copy, in Dutch, of Joannes Cassianus' Collationes patrum.

supportDesc.extent: iii + 162 + ii; 175 x 126 mm bound to 181 x 131 mm

layoutDesc.layout: Single column, twenty-five to twenty-seven lines per page, very light frame ruling visible on some pages, otherwise no visible ruling

binding.p: Original wooden boards, brown stamped calf, with remnants of clasps; lined with parchment leaves from a thirteenth-century manuscript in Dutch, mentioning Saint Agatha; spine cracked, first few quires (through folio 35) loose

history.provenance: Belonged (15th century) to the susteren van Sinte Cecilien convent bynnen Hoern
